full_text: 19. If in the U.S. is your spouse included in your request for asylum? Yes No (If not, explain why) N/A 20. If in the U.S. is spouse making separate application for asylum? Yes No (If not, explain why) N/A 21. If in the U.S. are children included in your request for asylum? Yes No (If not, explain why) Becase they already applied. 22. I have sons or daughters as follows: (Complete all columns as to each son or daughter. If living with you state "with me" in last column; otherwise give city and state or foreign country of son's or daughter's residence). Name Sex Place of birth Date of birth Now living at Manuela Espinoza_de_Romero F 23. Relatives in U.S. other than immediate family Name Address Relationship Immigration status Manuela Espinoza de Romero 4372 N. W. 7 St. Miami, FL Daughter Refugee 24. Other relatives who are refugees but outside the U.S. Name Relationship Country where presently located N/A 25. List all travel or identity documents such as national passport, refugee convention travel document or national identity card Issuing country or Date of Date of Document type Document number Cost issue expiration Obtained by whom authority Passport C 050367 Nicaragua 05-05-82 05-02-88 $20.00 By Agency 26. Why did you obtain a U.S. visa? I obtained a visa because I had to reunite with my Daughter here in the U.S.A. since she came escaping from the communism and of course she did not want to leave me in Nicaragua because she was scare that something might happen to me. 27. If you did not apply for a U.S. visa, explain why not? 28. Date of departure from your country of nationality 29. Was exit permission required to leave your country? Yes No (If so, did you obtain exit (Mo/Day/Yr) permission X Yes No (If not, explain why) 03-29-86 (2)
